channel.title: Emmys 2025 on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Emmys 2025 on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Nate Bargatze: “Big Dumb” Mogul
item.description: Forget the Porsche, the sold-out arenas, the theme park. The world’s most successful stand-up — and this year’s Emmy host — swears he’s still just a regular guy.

item.title: Nate Bargatze: “Big Dumb” Mogul
item.description: Forget the Porsche, the sold-out arenas, the theme park. The world’s most successful stand-up — and this year’s Emmy host — swears he’s still just a regular guy.

item.description: ‘Gilmore Girls’ stars Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel and ‘Wednesday’ castmembers Jenna Ortega and Catherine Zeta-Jones also are among those set to take the stage Sunday.

item.description: Awards handed out on Sunday include reality competition host, best documentary or nonfiction series, best structured reality program and writing for a variety special, among others.

item.title: Creative Arts Emmys: ‘Rebel Ridge’ Wins Best TV Movie
item.description: The Netflix thriller from Jeremy Saulnier stars Aaron Pierre as a former Marine out for justice.

item.title: Creative Arts Emmys: Shawn Hatosy and Merritt Wever Win for Best Guest Acting in a Drama
item.description: Hatosy won for his role as Dr. Jack Abbot in ‘The Pitt’ and Wever her portrayal of Gretchen George on ‘Severance.’

item.title: Creative Arts Emmys: Shawn Hatosy and Merritt Wever Win for Best Guest Acting in a Drama
item.description: Hatosy won for his role as Dr. Jack Abbot in ‘The Pitt’ and Wever her portrayal of Gretchen George on ‘Severance.’

item.title: ‘White Lotus’ Composer Wins Emmy After Mike White Fallout
item.description: Cristobal Tapia de Veer, who parted ways with the HBO drama and its creator earlier this year, won the award for best original main title theme music.

item.description: Cranston won for his role as Griffin Mill in ‘The Studio’ and Nicholson for her portrayal of Dance Mom on ‘Hacks.’

item.description: The now-canceled series is full of beautiful architectural shots, yet Mullen had a clear favorite in his Emmy-nominated episode, “The Swap.”

item.description: The 52-year-old, who is Emmy-nominated for producing and starring on Apple TV+’s hit drama series (he has never won before), reflects on three decades of highs and lows in Hollywood.

item.description: The show got a lot of attention for its restaurant industry commentary. But what it’s actually doing is telling us to get off the treadmill.
